# Monitoring

## Overview

<!-- Describe the monitoring strategy for {{repoName}}. -->

## Health Checks

| Endpoint | Method | Expected Response |
|----------|--------|-------------------|
| `/health` | `GET` | `200 OK` with `{"status": "healthy"}` |
| `/ready` | `GET` | `200 OK` when ready to accept traffic |

## Key Metrics

| Metric | Description | Alert Threshold |
|--------|-------------|-----------------|
| Request latency (p95) | 95th percentile response time | <!-- e.g. > 500ms --> |
| Error rate | Percentage of 5xx responses | <!-- e.g. > 1% --> |
| CPU utilisation | Average CPU usage | <!-- e.g. > 80% --> |
| Memory utilisation | Average memory usage | <!-- e.g. > 85% --> |

<!-- Describe the logging strategy: format, levels, and destinations. -->

- **Format:** <!-- e.g. Structured JSON -->
- **Levels:** `debug`, `info`, `warn`, `error`
- **Destination:** <!-- e.g. stdout -> log aggregator -->

## Alerting

| Alert | Condition | Severity | Channel |
|-------|-----------|----------|---------|
| High error rate | Error rate > threshold | Critical | <!-- e.g. PagerDuty --> |
| High latency | p95 > threshold | Warning | <!-- e.g. Slack --> |
